summary:
Management consultant and coach with an eye for diversity and effectiveness. Main areas of focus are national and organizational cultures, leadership/talent development, and team alignment. 

Over 35 years of experience in the international Engineering Consultancy and Project Execution arena, ranging from continuous performance improvement, project controls and marketing to strategy development, corporate responsibility, human resources policy, talent development - and the effective implementation of these together with project, operations, management and executive teams. 

Positions held include global leadership, home office and (foreign) project assignments, departmental management, and work within client organizations.  Clients have included multinationals and governmental, NGO and educational institutions.  Broad international experience was gained through projects involving multiple cultures and from having lived in Indonesia, the Netherlands, the Philippines, Canada, Japan, Greece and the USA.

profile_positions.description: Independent consultancy aimed at enhancing personal growth and organizational effectiveness. Recent assignments have included team building, enhancing company cultures, multinational project team alignment, complex tender preparation, and personal coaching in business and non-profit organisations.

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for three main areas: Global Training & Development, Management Review, and Culture Change. This included corporate leadership programs, coaching, succession planning and cultural awareness.  Provided one-on-one mentoring, coaching and intervention, as well as teambuilding. 

Special circumstances due to company merger. Member of pre-post merger implementation teams, Corporate HRM Management Team, Integrity Council, Crisis Team, and DHV Pension Board.
profile_positions.title: Dir. Leadership & Talent Development

profile_positions.description:
Provided strategic leadership in global HRM, raising the profile and respect for HRM across the DHV Group. Responsible for Global HR policies and processes with a focus on company culture and management & professional development. 

Supported Executive Board and management teams in consistent and effective implementation and communication of company strategy. Developed frameworks and provided guidance in the implementation of Corporate Responsibility globally.
profile_positions.title: Director Human Resource Management

profile_positions.description:
As member of the senior management team, participated in the development and communication of company strategy, and in stimulating synergy across organizational lines   Responsible for the framing and implementation of DHV Group Wide initiatives, with a strong emphasis on the one-company philosophy and increasing interconnectivity. 

Primary areas of focus included corporate responsibility, knowledge sharing, innovation and overall corporate communications. Represented the DHV Group in related external forums.
profile_positions.title: Director of Corporate Initiatives

profile_positions.description:
Marketing Manager
Responsible for Marketing Services in support of business development, communications and corporate citizenship activities. As member of the management team, co-developed regional strategy in alignment with corporate and business line strategy.

Provided one-on-one coaching in leadership and communication, and served on the Training Steering Committee.  Primary focus was in the Netherlands with a supporting role to Poland and assistance to other regions as needed. Additional responsibilities included implementation of Strategy-to-Win and Client Review processes. 

Communications & Strategic Implementation
As member of the management team, worked on regional strategy with a focus on Energy and Chemicals operations based in the Netherlands.   High emphasis on communications and the formation of the team. Continued to provide facilitation and training support to other business lines, including Infrastructure and Operations & Maintenance. 

Transportation Infrastructure Europe, Business Development & Management Team
Participated in the development of a European strategy, including market evaluation and segmentation, worked on significant proposals such as the Infraspeed consortium proposal for the high-speed rail superstructure in the Netherlands, and provided consulting services in target industries.

Continuous Improvement and Culture Leader
As member of the office Leadership Team provided focus for implementing the cultural and leadership mindset, including the following:
- Structured and strategy oriented improvement/change (learning) process
- Customer focus processes such as Client Review, and alliance /project team alignment
- Facilitator training
- Individual and team coaching on leadership, interdependent relationships and effectiveness
- Value Awareness and project specific and departmental work process improvement
- Enhancing communications regarding culture and strategy implementation.
profile_positions.title: Manager: Marketing, Business Development, Continuous Improvement

profile_positions.description:
Project Controls Team manager - Sunoco Strategic Alliance, Philadelphia, USA
Supervisor responsible for Project Controls and Project Cost Accounting activities on all upgrade projects at multiple refineries. As member of the Alliance core management team, responsibilities include joint planning with the client and Fluor Daniel of the overall Alliance objectives and work process improvement.  Functional responsibilities included coaching, audit of the invoicing and advance payment process, and analysis of profit projections.

During this period also provided support in strategic planning and project alignment, to the Operations Center and resident Operating Companies including, Pharmaceutical/Biotechnology/Chemicals, Gas Turbine, Petroleum & Petrochemicals, and Chemicals and Plastics. At Fluor corporate level, member of senior Organizational Engineers network for organizational change and improvement.
profile_positions.title: Project Controls Team Manager

profile_positions.description:
Project Controls General Supervisor
Responsible for full back-up of departmental manager in project staffing; resource development, commercial input to proposals; auditing of projects; improvement of work processes; and management reporting. Provided project controls oversight on small projects and studies. As Control Team Leader for the tail-end of the Shell Rayong Project, was responsible for on-going project controls and close-out planning.

Alignment Facilitator
Supported regional improvement and alignment activities, including facilitation for major clients such as Shell, DSM, Dupont, BASF, Fina, Gdansk, Mitsubishi Heavy Industries, Dow, ExxonMobil, and NAM; developed re-engineering initiatives such as Value Engineering, Tail-End Control, Work Shift Analysis, and prepared departmental strategic plans.
profile_positions.title: Project Controls General Supervisor, Alignment Facilitator

profile_positions.description:
CPI Regional Director, Northeast USA
Responsible for the Continuous Performance Improvement (CPI) program and development of resources in the region and Puerto Rico. Gained substantial alignment and client interface experience including alliance relationships.  Business units served included Pharmaceutical/Biochemical/Fine Chemical, Petroleum and Petrochemicals, Chemical and Plastics, Gas Turbine, Power Services, and Environmental.

Marketing Coordinator
Supported line sales and operations personnel in the pursuit of new work and preparation of effective sales material, proposals, presentations and trade shows. Continued as Work Process Improvement (WPI) instructor and alignment facilitator.

Special Assignment to Functional Leader Project Controls
Responsible for company wide initiatives related to Project Controls, including the Project Controls systems strategy for the 1990's, preparation of a detailed customer survey and conducting client interviews. Other activities included instruction in Work Process Improvement and facilitating project alignments.
profile_positions.title: CPI Regional Director, Marketing Coordinator, Functional Project Controls

profile_positions.description:
Project Controls Engineer II
Lead Cost Engineer on a program to engineer, procure, and construct state-of-the-art film finishing facilities.  Developed cost control procedures; provided cost and schedule control for the Operations, Packaging, Material Handling, Information Systems, and Maintenance teams. Prepared and managed the client's overall operational budget.

The project included in-depth study and implementation of progressive manufacturing and management techniques such as High Performance Work Systems, vertical slice teams, material/product flow focus, Performance Management, JIT, and Japanese concepts such as Kan Ban. Additional activities included instructing CPI/WPI classes in various FD offices, leading a CPI team in the development of a recognition program, co-development of an employee opinion survey, and support of the FD Community Involvement Team.

Project Controls Engineer I
Project Controls engineer on a fixed price contact between the Eastman Kodak Company and Xiamen Photographic Materials Company, to build a grassroots photographic manufacturing facility in the Peoples Republic of China. Provided cost and schedule control for Operations and Training, with particular focus on contract compliance.  Cost control of budget involving domestic and international divisions. Prepared the first detailed CPM accreditation schedule for film sensitizing at Kodak which formed the basis for all onsite start-up and commissioning activities.
profile_positions.title: Project Controls Engineer
